image.altText: Jack Petrou, who has type 2 diabetes, testing his blood glucose levels.

props.synopsis: Politicians regularly trade blows about ambulance ramping, elective surgery waiting lists, and maternity care. But little is being debated about preventative health.

title.children: Dad of three turns to clinic in diabetes 'hotspot' after watching father lose toes to Australia's fastest growing condition

image.altText: Two kids stand with ice creams

props.synopsis: Parts of the state reached almost 40C on Saturday with other outback towns feeling their hottest August weekend since 1985.

title.children: Queensland's last day of winter was the warmest we've felt in decades

image.altText: Mental Health Public Entry sign.

props.synopsis: The ABC has confirmed 19 adult mental health inpatients have ended their own lives while in Queensland mental health units since 2018.

title.children: Urgent call to upgrade Queensland's mental health units as ABC confirms 19 inpatient suicides in six years

image.altText: Fire fighter standing outside a smoking building in ruins

props.synopsis: Residents of Baralaba, central Queensland, have rallied to support the community's biggest music festival after a devastating blaze destroyed their iconic pub.

title.children: Tiny bush town's residents vow to fight on after fire rips out its heart and soul

image.altText: A graphic of a man and an air taxi

props.synopsis: Businessman John Wagner backs the use of flying taxis ahead of the 2032 Olympics but there are still a few hurdles for the technology to overcome.

title.children: Queensland multimillionaire joins 'air taxi' race ahead of 2032 Olympics

image.altText: A woman with long blonde hair in a black shirt kneeling in a field of sunflowers

props.synopsis: There have been multiple fatal crashes on the Bruce Highway this week. Experts say we must change our attitudes and behaviour.

title.children: Raina's heartfelt plea to drivers after losing her dad, best friend in road crashes

image.altText: A road ends at a smoking crater.

props.synopsis: A man has died on a detour set up after a massive truck explosion in Queensland. It could be weeks before the Bruce Highway reopens after the truck crash caused large-scale damage to the roadway.

title.children: Man killed on highway used as detour after massive truck explosion

image.altText: Bruce Highway explosion

props.synopsis: A section of the Bruce Highway is closed, adding about four hours for motorists with diversions in place.

title.children: Images reveal extent of damage after deadly truck explosion on major Queensland road

image.altText: Hands hold up a gold, silver and bronze medal

props.synopsis: Keep up with how many medals Aussie athletes won overnight — and where Australia sits on the leaderboard.

title.children: Here are the medal standings after day three of the Paralympic Games

image.altText: LGBT flag

props.synopsis: The prime minister says his government has not changed its policy on questions for the next census, despite being forced to clean up a messy debate over how the nation's LGBTQI+ community will be counted in the next survey.

title.children: Albanese insists Labor has not changed stance on LGBTQI+ questions in census

image.altText: A woman sits in a chair while her nails are filed at a salon in Melbourne.

props.synopsis: If you've been to a nail salon in Australia, chances are it was owned by a Vietnamese Australian. So, where did it all begin?

title.children: How Vietnamese Australians came to dominate the nail salon industry

image.altText: A firetruck drives through floodwater with blue and red lights reflecting in the water.

props.synopsis: The prolonged extreme weather event affecting Tasmania has left around 30,000 people without power overnight, with residents in a one community being told they should prepare to leave due to a flood risk.

title.children: Wild weather in Tasmania knocks out phone coverage, power

image.altText: People swim at a beach next to the buildings of a nuclear plant.

props.synopsis: Canada's biggest province generates 51 per cent of its power from nuclear and while some love it, there are still downstream issues to be solved.

title.children: Big nuclear is on the Coalition agenda but Ontario, Canada shows there are still issues to resolve

image.altText: Houses under construction on a bright, sunny day

props.synopsis: The shadow assistant minister for home ownership says the Coalition would consider withdrawing GST payments to "hit the states hard where it hurts" and encourage housing supply.

title.children: Coalition would consider docking GST from states who don't build enough new homes

image.altText: Li Na Lei and Qian Yang playing doubles para table tennis for Australia at the Paralympics

props.synopsis: Australia's para table tennis duo Li Na Lei and Qian Yang have won gold in the women's doubles WD20 at the Paralympics. Amanda Reid wins back-to-back gold medals in the women's C1-3 500m time trial. Follow live.

title.children: Lei and Yang win gold in para table tennis, Amanda Reid defends Paralympic title

image.altText: A video still of Tom Gleeson behind a podium. The ABC lissajous in the top left corner and the Hard Quiz logo in the top right

props.synopsis: Oh, you're back? Something to prove after last week's effort? Let's see what you've got.

title.children: Always said you'd smash Hard Quiz? I'll believe it when I see it

image.altText: A composite image shows headshots of Kamala Harris and Donald Trump

props.synopsis: As the energy around Kamala Harris's nomination settles and she emerges from her first real test, the strategy behind Republican attack ads becomes clear, writes Jade Macmillan.

title.children: As Kamala Harris emerges from a major interview, the Republican plan against her crystallises

image.altText: Casey Donovan dressed as a nun, in all black with a hint of white around her neck, a crucifix, hair out

props.synopsis: Casey Donovan stars as Deloris Van Cartier in Sister Act the musical, in a role made famous by Whoopi Goldberg in the 1992 film and 1993 sequel.

title.children: 'I hope I'm doing Deloris proud and also, Whoopi': Casey Donovan on her starring role in Sister Act the musical

image.altText: A young woman wearing glasses and a backpack stands on a university walkway.

props.synopsis: International students and university staff representatives are voicing concern that an international student cap could adversely impact the nation's tertiary institutions.

title.children: 'Sick of being punching bags': Concern that international student cap could spark more university sector job losses

image.altText: The entrance to the Royal Lodge at Windsor Park

props.synopsis: For years, King Charles and Prince Andrew have been at odds over a sweetheart deal cut between Andrew and his late mother to give him lifelong possession of a grand mansion on the grounds of Windsor Castle.

title.children: Charles reportedly wants to force his brother into Harry and Meghan's vacant house. Here's why

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur and Jordan Thompson join Alexei Popyrin in the US Open fourth round after setting up an all-Australian last-16 battle in New York.

image.altText: A massive upended tree base is seen from the side in a field with bare roots and debris

image.altText: A photo showing a bearded Indigenious man wearing a black hat and looking directly at the camera

props.synopsis: Syphilis is continuing to spread through remote Indigenous communities in Central Australia, with shame and stigma keeping many from getting tested.

title.children: Sex can be a taboo topic — but as syphilis spreads, Bradley is having the tough conversations

image.altText: Two coast guard ships collide.

props.synopsis: The Philippines and China exchange accusations of intentionally ramming coast guard vessels in disputed waters of the South China Sea, the latest in an escalating series of clashes in the vital waterway.

title.children: China, Philippines trade blame in latest South China Sea clash

image.altText: A man and a woman sit looking in opposite directions appearing troubled.

props.synopsis: You might have got the impression from social media that attachment styles can predict your love life. This take on relationships twists science into "unhelpful nonsense," say psychologists.

title.children: 'Idiocy at its finest': How TikTok gets it wrong about relationship attachment styles

image.altText: A man holding a painted stick in bushland

props.synopsis: Traditional owners share their knowledge to ward off the native animals after 16 high-risk dingo interactions this year.

title.children: K'gari visitors use Indigenous traditional method to protect themselves from dingoes

image.altText: A photo of Starbucks CEO Brian Niccol is surrounded by highlighted print documents

props.synopsis: The new Starbucks boss gets a jet for his commute — but that's just a sweetener.

title.children: Why it cost Starbucks $100m and a jet-fueled commute to poach its new CEO

image.altText: two men, young and old, shaking hands in front of the ocean

props.synopsis: Kimberley youth Tremane Baxter-Edwards hopes to one day be Australia's first Indigenous prime minister.

title.children: The failed Voice referendum has 'galvanised' First Nations leaders in the Kimberley

image.altText: A table full of teenagers look at the camera

props.synopsis: Seth Rogan, James Franco, Judd Apatow and more launched their careers with a show that was cancelled after one season. But Freaks and Geeks has become a bona fide cult classic.

title.children: Watching Freaks and Geeks now is like looking into a crystal ball for future Hollywood A-listers

image.altText: Melissa Wu dives at the Glasgow Commonwealth Games

props.synopsis: Nationals leader David Littleproud said Victorians will be "embarrassed" as Glasgow underlines its bid for a streamlined 2026 Commonwealth Games, almost exclusively funded by $200 million of state government money.

title.children: Scottish Commonwealth Games bid 'adds to embarrassment' for Victorian government

image.altText: A middle-aged woman readies a small dripper of liquid for a small child lying on a bed next to some pink balloons.

props.synopsis: Children began receiving vaccines on Saturday, Gaza's health ministry says, a day before the large-scale rollout and first three-day "humanitarian pause" in fighting agreed to by Israel and the UN's World Health Organization.

title.children: Children in Gaza begin receiving polio vaccine, while hostilities continue to worsen in occupied West Bank

image.altText: Gold medallist Emily Petricola of Australia celebrates on the podium.

props.synopsis: Emily Petricola broke a world record and defended her C4 3,000m pursuit Paralympic crown. But the para cycling champion had her Paris dream threatened twice in the lead-up to the Games.

title.children: Petricola overcomes MS flare and bike crash to win gold again

image.altText: Jake Gordon slides over to score a try

props.synopsis: The Wallabies have claimed a thrilling, one-point victory over Argentina in appalling conditions in La Plata.

title.children: Wallabies win thriller over Argentina with final kick of the game

image.altText: An older man wearing hi-vis coat smiles, photographed from the side, against a grey sky

props.synopsis: Scientists are concerned that a toxic herbicide widely used in Australian farming could be linked to the growing prevalence of Parkinson's disease. It sat on the regulator's shelf for review for decades, while the company manufacturing it worked to publicly discredit evidence that its product was harmful.

title.children: Parkinson's has been called the silent pandemic, and scientists believe a common farm chemical could be one cause
